definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: Now I can relax a little bit and save a little bit every month.
sentences.chinese: 現在我可以放鬆一點了，每個月也有點節餘了。

sentences.english: Reducing administrative costs and using the savings for development activities.
sentences.chinese: 政開支，把節餘的資金用於發展活動。

sentences.english: This abstemiousness has served it well as the commodity cycle has turned.
sentences.chinese: 這些節餘在商品週期由盛轉衰的時候大派用場。

sentences.english: Would you please tell me my balance?
sentences.chinese: 請把我帳號上的節餘金額告訴我好嗎？

sentences.english: I want to cash the balance of a traveler's letter of credit.
sentences.chinese: 我要把觀光信用證的節餘兌現。

sentences.english: The discretionary savings are spread between both domestic and defense spending.
sentences.chinese: 自由支配性開支的節餘將在國內和國防支出中分攤。

sentences.english: The balance of my board expenses was all spent on new books for English learning.
sentences.chinese: 我將伙食費的節餘部分全用來購買英語學習的新書了。
